basics.name: Michael Van Der Velden
basics.phone: contact me for my phone number
basics.description: My name is Michael. I am a full stack javascript developer based in Liverpool. At age 16, I founded a limited company to sell a web based reward system to businesses. I worked on this product with 2 others and while it is no longer running, it helped me to gain an appreciation for various aspects of the software development and sales cycle. At the beginning of 2018, I joined Mashbo, where I currently work on client based web apps and websites. I have worked on numerous open source projects which can be found on my linked Github and Twitter accounts. I am a strong member of any team and am always happy and open to new ideas and approaches.

highlights: Design and Build our gratitude based reward system using a range of technologies
Ensure the site was presentable and pitch it to potential investors
Ensure that the companies finances kept us afloat
Pitch the product to potential buyers
Took part in regular "Clean Code" Sessions
Had regular meetings with owner, Andy Kent, about my own company
Discussed Programing best practice with team members
Build stateful web applications using Ember.JS
Work with clients to ensure Wordpress blogs met their design brief
Manage deadlines to ensure that client projects got out the door by given release dates
Research new technologies that could make products better for clients

keywords: I'm at ease speaking in front of large and small crowds alike
I can easily listen to a range of solutions and decide on a plan of approach
I can take criticism in my stride and use it to better myself
I can work in a team or alone depending on what the situation requires

projects.name: Thanks
projects.description: Although the project is no longer up and running, Thanks was a gratitude based reward system for employees and students wherein helping your coworkers could be internally recognised and later rewarded. It was the primary product of my company, Vandie Studios Ltd.

projects.name: Centre for Alternative Technology
projects.description: While working at Mashbo, a client wanted a Wordpress website that combined there many sites into one. After a long set of planning, I realised that the we could offer them increased flexibility despite the limitation of the Wordpress platform by building a modular "blocks" system for their website. After working with the in-house designer to split his design into "blocks, My coworkers agreed and I looked at building a prototype for the system. A little after the site was signed off by the client, Wordpress Gutenberg was released with many of the same ideas that we had put into the CAT website.

projects.name: Property Cloud
projects.description: One of Mashbo's biggest products, Property cloud is an online student accommodation management tool. Allowing students to get paperwork filled quickly, report issues easily all the while decreasing the amount of work required by agents. I worked on property cloud sporadically, when required, and helped restructure the routing system for the project as well as making the login flow simpler and more fluid. One of the first tasks I had on the project was to build the current (accurate as of 20th of Feb 2019) landing page.
